results.title: Bananas in pyjamas: the big parade
results.creator_credit: Di Drew, Tammy Burnstock and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: B1 and B2 are always on the lookout for fun while the Teddies and Rat in a Hat are always ready to join in. Life is full of surprises in Cuddles Avenue. There are ten stories in this compilation which include: Pink spots; Rat’s hat; Big parade; Pony ride; Magic lamp; Salon rat; Play time; Treasure hunt, Fire fire and Circus time. In the title episode, B1, B2 and all their friends make their very own circus parade.

results.title: Bangers. Feeling sexy
results.creator_credit: Andrew Upton, Davida Allen, Cate Blanchett, Glenys Rowe, Binnaburra Film Company and Pacific Film and Television Commission.
results.brief_description: Bangers (1998, 9 min)- Julie-Anne (Cate Blanchett) comes home from a hard day at the office to discover that her mother (Lynette Curran) has locked the cat in the house all day and that she is expected to cook ‘bangers’ for dinner. Preparing the meal becomes a manifestation of all the repressed tension in Julie-Anne’s work and home life. “Feeling sexy” (1998, 50 min)- This film is renowned painter Davida Allen’s first feature film. Vicki (Susie Porter) is a passionate and vivacious artist whose love for lust and life is slowly being stifled by domestic doldrums. Unable to elicit appropriate responses from her doctor husband Greg (Tamblyn Lord), Vicki embarks on a carnal affair with art student Hugo. When Vicki confesses her indiscretion to Greg, punishment comes in the shape of a blue-heeler who nearly destroys the house and Vicki’s psyche. Novelty being the spice of life, Vicki will have to call on all the resources of her creativity and imagination to coax Greg along on the path to restoring their relationship.

results.title: Bangarra Dance Theatre: ochres
results.creator_credit: Stephen Burstow, ABC-TV (Australia) and Bangarra Dance Theatre
results.brief_description: Recorded during the 1996 Festival of Perth, this production is an exemplary work from the dancers and musicians of the Bangarra Dance Theatre Company, Australia, acclaimed for its fusion of contemporary dance and indigenous traditional styles as well as original musical scores. The performance is centred around the substance Ochres, a material with both physical and spiritual purposes in traditional and urban Aboriginal culture, and from which Stephen Page drew inspiration for his original creation of the choreography for the production in 1994. The dance performance is structured around the characteristics, qualities and variety of symbolic significances of the substance. Divided into 5 parts, it begins with the spirit of Ochres, ‘the light’, then the performance shifts to a study of Ochres’ four essential colours; yellow, black, red and white. The performance features Bangarra Dance Theatre Company artists Gary Lang, Marilyn Miller, Djakapurra Munyarryun, Russell Page, Albert David, Kathryn Dunn, Frances Rings and Gina Rings in a seamless video capture of a powerful dance work.

results.title: Bananas in pyjamas: monster bananas
results.creator_credit: Tony Tilse, Helena Harris and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: B1 and B2, the Teddies and the Rat-in-the-hat are up to their old tricks in ten different stories: “Goldilocks Bananas”, “Magic Carpet”, “Wibbly Wobbly”, “Monster Bananas”, “Morgan’s Cubby”, “Ratmobile”, “Strictly Bananas”, “Shadow Painting”, “Banana Shop” and “Mirror Mirror.” Some of the escapades include B1 and B2 disguising themselves as sea-monsters when they find some seaweed on the beach and their crazy attempts at carpentry where they try to mend furniture but end up redesigning it instead!

results.title: Bananas in pyjamas: it's music time!
results.creator_credit: Sophia Turkiewicz, Tony Tilse, Helena Harris and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: B1 and B2 and their friends the Teddies embark on eight terrific adventures. Includes two fun filled songs as well as the famous “Bananas in pyjamas” signature song. All the episodes have a musical theme.

results.title: Bananas in pyjamas birthday special
results.brief_description: The bananas, B1 and B2 and the teddies Amy, Lulu and Morgan have lots of fun together and they get up to lots of mischief as well. “Cuddles Avenue” - the naughty bananas decide to play a trick on the teddies. “Birthday Week” - it’s the bananas’ birthday on Friday and the excitement builds as the teddies prepare a surprise party. “Wet Paint” - Amy and Morgan can’t resist touching the brand new paint of the park bench, just to see if it is really wet. “Fancy Dress” - the bananas and teddies have been invited to a fancy dress party.

results.title: Ballad of a young man = Wadjah seorang laki-laki
results.creator_credit: Teguh Karya, Turino Djunaidy and Sarinande Films
results.brief_description: Nineteenth century Dutch Batavia serves as a backdrop to influential Indonesian director Teguh Karya’s first feature. ‘Ballad of a Young Man’ is about Amallo, a local of Portuguese descent, and his troubled relationship with his womanising father. His father is an important man in the village who works for the Dutch, keeping watch over their horses. Amallo, on the other hand, is a rebel who steals ammunition and horses from the Dutch soldiers. When Amallo returns to his village after spending some time in the city, he is betrayed by his best friend who is consumed with jealousy. Meanwhile, Amallo’s father has been promoted by the Dutch for recovering stolen horses. The film is told in flashback, a favourite storytelling technique of the director (see also ‘Bitter Coffee’). Slamet Rahardjo - protege of Teguh Karya - now Head of the Film Council and a prominent figure in Indonesia, makes his acting debut as Amallo. Cast also includes W.D. Mochtar and Rima Melati. In Indonesian with English subtitles.

results.title: Balto
results.creator_credit: Simon Wells, Steve Hickner, Amblin Entertainment and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, Balto is part husky/part wolf looking for a place to belong. An outcast in Alaska, he has few true friends - Boris the Russian snow goose, polar bear cubs Muk and Luk and the beautiful husky Jenna. Balto becomes a hero when the small town of Nome is struck by a diptheria epidemic. A blizzard means that medicine for the children cannot be delivered unless a team of sled dogs can race 600 miles to bring it back. When the dogs become lost, Balto must come to the rescue. Features the voices of Kevin Bacon, Bridget Fonda, Bob Hoskins and Phil Collins.

results.title: Balinese surfer
results.creator_credit: Bill Leimbach, Tony Dutton and Survival Films
results.brief_description: Shows how the younger generation on the island of Bali have overcome the traditional Balinese fear of the sea to excel in the sport of surfing. Also explains the Balinese attitude to religion and how it is absorbed into every facet of their lives, especially their art and dancing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Leimbach, Tony Dutton and Survival Films

results.title: Ballet mecanique (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The French cubist painter Fernand Leger collaborated with American photographer Dudley Murphy to produce a dynamic view of modern life in the 1920’s. Using a series of rapidly intercut contrasting images, the film reduces humans to mechanical objects, creating rhythms and patterns of expressive force.
